intro: Drosanthemum bredai, commonly known as the orange-stemmed pincushion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its succulent characteristics and ability to store water in its leaves and stems. The plant produces vibrant, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, often blooming in summer. Its compact, cushion-like growth habit makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Drosanthemum bredai is well adapted to arid environments, thriving in full sun and well-drained soil.
